newsitem.title: USA: CSCE launches butter futures, nine lots traded.
newsitem.headline: CSCE launches butter futures, nine lots traded.

text.p: Nine lots changed hands in the first day of trade of Coffee, Sugar and Cocoa Exchange's new butter futures contract, CSCE said.
The contract was launched to augment risk management tools available to the dairy industry. Other contracts in CSCE's dairy line include milk, Cheddar cheese and nonfat dry milk.

The butter futures contract calls for FOB delivery of USDA Grade AA "fresh" or "storage" salted butter, at any point in the continental U.S. The trading unit is 10,000 lbs with a delivery unit of 40,000 lbs.
Butter futures will trade between 0900 and 1400 EDT, and contract months include February, April, June, August, October and December. The contract trades in cents per lb.
